intro: Veyretia caudata, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Veyretia caudata is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. It is also known for its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation.
